intro: Tetrastigma megacarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited cross-vine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and tendrils that aid in climbing. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by large, edible berries. Its botanical features include the presence of tendrils, palmate leaves, and distinctive fruit morphology. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
